Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gnome-settings-daemon
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnome-settings-daemon bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The gnome-settings-daemon packages contain a daemon to share settings from GNOME with other applications. The daemon also handles global key bindings, as well as a number of desktop-wide settings. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, when using certain Wacom tablets with multi-display configurations, the touchscreen was incorrectly mapped to the span of more than one monitor. With this update, the stylus is correctly mapped, and is thus limited only to its actual displays. (BZ#1029612) Prior to this update, gnome-settings-daemon terminated unexpectedly on exit. Consequently, the user was unable to switch to the root user as this process also crashed with a segmentation fault. This bug has been fixed, and the crash on exit no longer occurs. (BZ#1145144) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: This update adds support for the microphone mute buttons on ThinkPad Lenovo T440 laptops. (BZ#1108934) Users of gnome-settings-daemon are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
